text:
Apache should incorporate several features to protect it from (D)Dos-attacks. 
Such features could be: limiting logfile-size, limiting (peak-)bandwidth and 
connections per time-unit and/or ip/addressblock.

With the fast growing number of broadband connections, client-side bandwidth is 
growing faster as server-side bandwidth and capability. Thus making HTTP-
services more vulnerable to such attacks.
While third-party and commercial solutions are availeble, these can be very 
expensive or not actively maintained. Also, such security features should be 
availeble after a basic installation.
creator: info@orangexl.com

text:
Certainly we appreciate suggestions, but I have a couple problems with this
bug report:

1. Most of these DoS-prevention strategies are much better implemented either
at the router or at the OS level.  Although certainly there is more that
could be done at the Apache level too.

2. This bug report is way too broad.  Since there is no way that we could ever say
that this bug is "fixed", it will just hang around forever.

Because of reason 2, I'm going to close this report.   That doesn't mean the
issue isn't important.  If you would like to help more, I suggest one of the
following:

a) Get involved with the dev@httpd.apache.org mailing list.

b) File more specific bug reports.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
